poem:
Title: An Elegy for 99 Cents Only

Within aisles of lost thrift, a penny's dream brimming with wares,
Now spools into silence under economic despair.
The echo of coins spins a requiem, harsh, unfair,
Mike speaks of pressures, mountains they couldn't bear.
Each cent depreciated as hope took the final blow,
In the downfall of bounty, we reap what we sow.
